summary: An FBI Miami Division request to the Document Conversion Laboratory (DocLab) and Special Technologies and Applications Office (STAO) for scanning, automation, and data formatting assistance for telephone records related to the obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez. The records are from an address book belonging to Jeffrey Epstein that Rodriguez attempted to sell, believed to contain contact information for additional underage victims and Epstein associates.

persons.name: Alfredo Rodriguez
persons.role: Subject of obstruction of justice investigation, former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The FBI Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against him in October 2009. He possessed an address book belonging to Jeffrey Epstein containing names and numbers of potential underage victims and attempted to sell it.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Subject of a child prostitution case
persons.context: Alfredo Rodriguez was his former house manager and butler. The address book Rodriguez possessed belonged to Epstein and contained contact information for potential underage victims and associates.

connections.description: Rodriguez was the former house manager and butler to Jeffrey Epstein.
Rodriguez came into possession of an address book belonging to Epstein containing potential victim information and attempted to sell it, obstructing justice in Epstein's case.

events.title: FBI opens obstruction case against Rodriguez
events.description: Miami Division opened an obstruction of justice case against Alfredo Rodriguez.

events.title: Timeframe for telephone records
events.description: Telephone records generated between September 1, 2001, and the present (June 2010) are relevant to the investigation.

events.title: Rodriguez attempts to sell Epstein's address book
events.description: Alfredo Rodriguez attempted to sell an address book belonging to Jeffrey Epstein, containing names and numbers of potential underage victims, to an Undercover Employee (UCE) instead of turning it over to law enforcement or attorneys in response to federal subpoenas.

keyFacts: Alfredo Rodriguez, Jeffrey Epstein's former house manager, was under FBI investigation for obstruction of justice for attempting to sell an address book belonging to Epstein that contained contact information for potential underage victims.

The FBI was processing telephone records from the address book, believed to belong to Epstein, his associates, or potential underage victims, for incorporation into the Telephone Application (TA) investigative database.
The document is a formal FBI request for technical support (scanning, automation, data formatting) to process these records as part of the 'Baleen Sweep' project.
The address book contained names and telephone numbers of what were believed to be additional, previously unknown underage victims of Jeffrey Epstein.
